- Great practical experience with various biomedical and forensic techniques and methods.

- Excellent interpersonal, leadership and teamwork skills in building and maintaining good relations while getting tasks done within stipulated time.

- Recognized as a hard-working individual who aims for effective problem-solving and well-liked by peers and professors.

projects.title: HIT OR BURN? – Differentiating blunt force trauma fractures from heat-induced fractures in bones
projects.description:
Trauma interpretation from burned remains, being a persisting challenge, affects events reconstruction in forensic casework. The similarity, the co-existence and overlapping of features of traumatic fractures and heat-induced fractures (HIFs) accounts for this problem. Scarce literature exists for this issue, particularly for blunt force trauma (BFT) and these studies utilized animal bones. 

To address this problem, this project (Master's thesis) aimed to distinguish the characteristics of BFT-fractures and HIFs (and situational fractures) in burned bones. 
Long-bones were subjected to either trauma or fire, or both trauma and fire. Analysis of human cadaveric arms was done macroscopically (using a checklist) and micscropically. Custom-made device and apt pyre were built for fracturing and burning of bones, respectively.

Differences between BFT-fractures and HIFs, post-burning, were observed. There were also features were very similar between some fractures, that could cause misidentification of fracture type. Most of the observed features agreed with former studies. Interestingly, some key novel findings were also seen.

This project moreover showed the effectiveness of a checklist of both quantitative and qualitative features for fracture differentiation. It was concluded that differentiation of traumatic fractures from HIFs is possible through meticulous analysis.

projects.title: A review of the advantages and pitfalls of the techniques and methods which may provide insight in temporal changes of traumatic brain injury.
projects.description:
This was a literature thesis, supervised by dhr. prof. dr. M.C.G. (Maurice) Aalders, from the AMC, Amsterdam and Co van Ledden Hulsebosch Center (CLHC, Amsterdam).

Traumatic brain injury (TBI) exists around the globe as a serious issue. The morbidity and mortality attached to it is high. TBI is an acquired injury resulting from external physical force impacting the head, consequently injuring the brain. The impacting forces arises from variety of causes. This thesis dealt with one such cause – physical abuse. Subdural haematoma and diffuse axonal injury were of focus. Array of methods are available for TBI detection and for dating.

In this literature review, few of these methods were evaluated based on a custom-made list of criteria. This list was derived from the requirements of a good scientific method and the forensically-relevant Daubert guidelines. The different methods were cross-compared and the pros and cons were identified. These methods were broadly categorized as,

- Histomorphological methods
- Immunohistochemistry (IHC)
- Biomarkers
- Neuroimaging 
- Spectroscopic methods

projects.title: Discuss the importance of microRNAs in skin morphogenesis and diseases.
projects.description:
Upon the initial discovery of lin4 and let7 in C.elegans, studies using miRNAs (miRs) have 
demonstrated their significant roles in almost all biological processes including skin physiology and pathology. 

In this dissertation (Bachelor's thesis), the biogenesis of miRs followed by the roles of notable miRs in skin morphogenesis and pathologies have been critically discussed. These roles include:

•	The global role of miRs which was identified from the neonatal lethality and severe 
phenotypes in transgenic mice, due to ablation of Dicer and DGCR8. 
•	Specific roles of individual miRs such as in stem cell maintenance (miR203), epidermal differentiation (miR720, miR574-3p), cell cycle progression (miR34), anti-apoptosis (miR205) as well as in hair cycling (miR125b and miR31) and melanogenesis (Dicer and miR218). 
•	Implication of miRs in skin pathologies such as wound healing (variable miR expression based on wound healing phase), cancers (majorly melanoma, cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma and basal cell carcinoma) and pathogenesis of psoriasis.

projects.title: PCR-mediated detection of P53 genetic alterations in codon 72 of p53 gene in MCF-7 cancer cell line and in codon 280 of p53 gene in MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cell line.
projects.description:
The p53 tumour suppressor gene which is crucial for maintenance of genomic stability, is frequently mutated leading to formation of non-functional p53 protein. Such genetically altered p53 proteins are associated with the development and progression of human breast cancer. This project (experiment) aimed to determine two of these p53 genetic alterations:

•	Polymorphism at codon 72 causes a homozygous proline genotype that worsens prognosis for breast cancer patients
•	Missense mutation at codon 280

Two different human breast cancer cell lines namely MCF-7 and MDA-MB-231 were utilized. Promega’s Wizard Genomic DNA purification kit (A1120) was used to extract DNA from harvested cells. The aforementioned genetic alterations were detected via PCR-RFLP using Promega’s PCR Master Mix and three specific primer sets with subsequent restriction digestion using BstUI.  Plausible presence of polymorphism and confirmed presence of mutation, in codons 72 and 278 respectively, were observed.

profile_positions.description:
Chocoa is an yearly event in Amsterdam that is aimed at bridging connections between various domains of the cocoa industry and chain. 

For Chocoa 2018, a free online matchmaking service called ‘Chocoa 4 Business’ is introduced through an online application called ‘Grip’. The matchmaking application is a free service for visitors of the business events, exhibitors, speakers and sponsors with their details. This way they can get connected before Chocoa and meet each other during the festival. These events are excellent opportunities for meeting new business relations. ‘Chocoa 4 Business’ contains information about exhibitors, visitors, speakers and sponsors. The Matchmaking app can be considered as a combination between Tinder and LinkedIn. 

As part of the marketing team for this application, my role is to collate, analyze, organize and refine data regarding the various people/companies. I also communicate with these people/companies via email to ensure accuracy and credibility of information. The data is then transferred to the App for effective usage by participants. During the festival, I helped with on-spot technical issues and data matters for the app.
